page.title: 16THE ENGLAND/WALES BORDER
page.content: This stretch of the River Wye forms a natural boundary between England and Wales,the English county being Gloucestershire,and the Welsh county Gwent which was originally Monmouthshire. In this area there is no road connection between England and Wales, access between the two being only by an ancient footbridge. As Gwent was originally Monmouthshire the people are English speaking although the gift shops are full of Welsh souvenirs. The division causes the area to be represented by two different Members of Parliament and to be under separate local and national government authorities.However the whole area falls under the same telephone exchange and postal address.
